      Methods in interfaces that return PlayState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description

      relevant for the ai and the ui, returns the changed PlayState after the Player won the auction.

      asks the player to play a card.
      PlayState InGameInterface.askToSetPlayState​(PlayState ps)

      gives a player his hand cards.
      void InGameInterface.openSwitchSkat​(PlayState ps)
      only relevant for the ui.

      Receive the cards that were dealt to this player.
      void NetworkLogic.receivePlayState​(PlayState playState)
      Declarer set the playState.
      void LogicNetwork.sendPlayState​(PlayState ps)
      sends out the play state to all other clients.
      void InGameInterface.setPlaySettingsAfterAuction​(PlayState ps)
      especially for the ai to know which PlayMode is played.
      java.util.ArrayList<Card> GuiLogic.sortHand​(PlayState ps, java.util.List<Card> cardlist)
      supposed to sort the cards from jack to trump to lowest value.
      java.util.List<Card> InGameInterface.switchSkat​(PlayState ps)
      relevant for the ai and the ui, returns the two cards so lay on the declarers stack, only if askToTakeUpSkat returns true.

    • Uses of PlayState in logic

      Methods in logic that return PlayState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static PlayState Play.calculatePoints​(PlayState ps, GameSettings gameSettings, boolean declarerWins)
      calculates the value of the game.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsBierlachs​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      only minuspoints here for the player/s who won.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsNormal​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      if declarer won, the value of the game is added to his/her gamePoints else twice the value is subtracted from his/her score.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsOverBit​(PlayState ps)
      The amount subtracted from the declarer's score is twice the least multiple of the base value of the game actually played which would have fulfilled the bid.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsSeegerfabian​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      declarer gets or looses (the playValue + 50).
      PlayState PlayState.copyMe()
      returns a deep copy of this playState.
      Methods in logic with parameters of type PlayState 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static PlayState Play.calculatePoints​(PlayState ps, GameSettings gameSettings, boolean declarerWins)
      calculates the value of the game.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsBierlachs​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      only minuspoints here for the player/s who won.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsNormal​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      if declarer won, the value of the game is added to his/her gamePoints else twice the value is subtracted from his/her score.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsOverBit​(PlayState ps)
      The amount subtracted from the declarer's score is twice the least multiple of the base value of the game actually played which would have fulfilled the bid.
      static PlayState Play.calculatePointsSeegerfabian​(PlayState ps, boolean declarerWins)
      declarer gets or looses (the playValue + 50).
      static java.util.List<Player> Play.calculateWinner​(PlayState ps)
      Calculates the winner of the play, and saves it in the boolean singlePlayerWins uses calculatePoinsOfStack.
      Player Trick.calculateWinner​(PlayState ps)
      the winning card is calculated and the winner is returned submethods (depending on PlayMode): calculateWinnerColour(), calculateWinnerGrand(), calculateWinnerNull()).
      int Trick.calculateWinnerSuit​(PlayState ps)
      calulates the winning card in the playmode Suit.
      static boolean ClientLogic.checkIfCardPossible​(Card card, Card firstCard, PlayState playState, Player player)
      its is checked if the card can be played by the player depending on his hand, the first Colour of the trick and the PlayMode.
      static boolean ClientLogic.checkIfCardPossibleColour​(Card card, Card firstCard, PlayState playState, Player player)
      submethod of checkIfCardPossible.
      static boolean ClientLogic.checkIfCardPossibleGrand​(Card card, Card firstCard, Player player, PlayState playState)
      submethod of checkIfCardPossible.
      static boolean ClientLogic.checkIfServedColour​(Card servingCard, Card servedCard, PlayState playState)
      checks if the serving card serves the served card --> checks if both are trump/jack or have the same color, returns true if served.
      static boolean Play.checkOverBid​(PlayState ps)
      returns true if declarer over bid false if not.
      int Trick.compareCardsSuit​(Card card1, Card card2, PlayState ps)
      compares two cards with the current trump.
      void ClientLogic.receiveCards​(java.util.List<Card> cards, PlayState ps)
      player receives cards after they were dealt out, the playState and the hand are initialized and the auction is started by the middlehand.
      void ClientLogic.receivePlayState​(PlayState ps)
      is called after the auction winner set the playSettings, if this player sits forehand, the play is started here, by playing the first card.
      void ClientLogic.setPlayState​(PlayState ps)  
      java.util.ArrayList<Card> GameController.sortHand​(PlayState ps, java.util.List<Card> cardlist)  
      void Player.sortHand​(PlayState ps)
      sorts the players hand.
      static java.util.ArrayList<Card> Tools.sortHand​(java.util.ArrayList<Card> hand, PlayState ps)
      returns a resorted hand.
